snippet: A disclosure of documents obtained by Edward J. Snowden suggests the countries eavesdropped at 2009 conferences.
abstract: Classified documents are disclosed that suggest Edward J Snowden, former National Security Agency contractor who has provided trove of documents to The Guardian newspaper, had obtained wider ranger of materials about government surveillance than had been known; one of the documents reveals methods used by American and British intelligence agencies to eavesdrop on world leaders at conferences in London in 2009.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and RAVI SOMAIYA
byline.contributor: John M. Broder contributed reporting from Washington, and John F. Burns from London.

lead_paragraph: A disclosure of documents obtained by Edward J. Snowden suggests the countries eavesdropped at 2009 conferences.

headline.main: New Leak Indicates Britain and U.S. Tracked Diplomats
headline.print_headline: New Leak Indicates U.S. and Britain Eavesdropped at ’09 World Conferences

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
